Class QueryTree

java.lang.Object
  QueryTree

public class QueryTree
extends java.lang.Object

Creates a binary tree to be used for simple guessing games.

Version:
CSC 143 Winter 15
Author:
Matthew Staehely

Method Detail

finalGuess

public java.lang.String finalGuess()
Returns the final guess of this Query Tree.

Returns:
the final guess.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Tree is not ready to make a final guess.

hasNextQuestion

public boolean hasNextQuestion()
Checks to see if there is another question which needs to be asked. This will return true until the tree is at a leaf, and has found a final answer.

Returns:
true if another question needs to be asked on the way to a final guess.

nextQuestion

public java.lang.String nextQuestion()
Method to ask the user the next question to narrow down the search. Accesses the data of the current node and displays it in String format.

Returns:
the question being asked.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called and there are no further questions to ask.

readIn

public void readIn(java.io.File f)
            throws java.io.IOException
Reads in a new question/answer set, altering the state of this QueryTree. This file should be in pre-ordered format. Files must be in the correct format or the method will not function properly. Correct format is as follows: Every odd line must either indicate if the node to be created is a question "Q:" or answer "A:". The line following this must be the data to be stored in the node, either as the question to be asked or answer to be offered.

Parameters:
f - the input file.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a file is attempted to be read while the tree is currently in a state of guessing.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file passed does not meet the specified format.
java.io.IOException

updateTree

public void updateTree(java.lang.String q,
                       java.lang.String item,
                       char input)
Updates the QueryTree when a new item is learned.

Parameters:
q - the new question to ask.
item - the new item to be added.
input - the yes or no answer to the new question which leads to this item.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if 'y' or 'n' not passed to the character parameter. Note this is not case-sensitive.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a final guess has not been made.

userResponse

public void userResponse(char input)
Advances to the next subtree in the QueryTree based on the user's response.

Parameters:
input - the yes or no response to the question in the form of 'y' or 'n'.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input is not either y or n. Note that this is not a case-sensitive argument.

writeOut

public void writeOut(java.io.File f)
              throws java.io.IOException
Writes the current set of questions/answers in to the given output file. Does not alter the current state of this QueryTree.

Parameters:
f - the output file to be created.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the output file cannot be written to.
